keyFacts: The post for Special Housing Unit #1 is designated as an Oleoresin Capsicum (OC/pepper spray) carry post, but is not an armed post.
Officers are required to conduct irregular inmate observation rounds at least twice per hour, with no more than 40 minutes between checks, and must document all observations.
Official inmate counts require a 'double staff count' where one officer counts 'living breathing flesh' while another observes for unauthorized movement; counts are called in to a C&A Officer.
Inmates in SHU are escorted to court at a ratio of two staff members per inmate unless otherwise instructed.

The document states Bureau of Prisons policy that if an inmate takes a staff member hostage, the officer's first consideration is institutional security and under no circumstances are inmates to be permitted to escape.
